meanings.definition: Inclined or disposed to please; obliging
meanings.sent1: She was very complaisant and always willing to help others.
meanings.sent2: The complaisant waiter happily took their special requests.
meanings.sent3: The complaisant puppy wagged its tail eagerly, wanting to please its owner.
meanings.sent4: Her complaisant nature was like a warm hug on a cold day, comforting and welcoming.
meanings.sent5: The complaisant smile on her face made everyone feel at ease and happy.

meanings.definition: Willing to comply with the wishes of others
meanings.sent1: He was so complaisant that he always agreed to whatever his friends suggested.
meanings.sent2: Being complaisant, she never hesitated to go along with the group's decisions.
meanings.sent3: The complaisant student nodded along to the teacher's instructions, eager to please.
meanings.sent4: Her complaisant attitude was like a gentle breeze, bending easily to others' desires.
meanings.sent5: In a world full of demands, his complaisant nature stood out as a rare gem of flexibility.

meanings.definition: Showing a desire to please; agreeable
meanings.sent1: The complaisant child always tried to make everyone happy around him.
meanings.sent2: She had a complaisant personality that made her a joy to be around.
meanings.sent3: The complaisant cat purred contentedly as it received affection from its owner.
meanings.sent4: Her complaisant demeanor was like a soothing melody, bringing harmony to every interaction.
meanings.sent5: The complaisant attitude of the team made working together a delightful experience.
